meanings.definition: The action of taking possession of a mortgaged property when the borrower fails to keep up with mortgage payments.
meanings.sent1: The foreclosure on the house happened after the family couldn't pay their mortgage.
meanings.sent2: The bank initiated foreclosure proceedings on the property due to missed payments.
meanings.sent3: The foreclosure of the house led to a new family moving in.
meanings.sent4: The foreclosure loomed over them like a dark cloud, reminding them of their financial struggles.
meanings.sent5: The foreclosure was a harsh reality check for the homeowners, forcing them to find a new place to live.

meanings.definition: The process of selling property to recover a debt.
meanings.sent1: After the foreclosure, the bank auctioned off the property to recoup the debt.
meanings.sent2: The foreclosure sale attracted many bidders interested in buying the property.
meanings.sent3: The foreclosure turned into a bidding war, surprising everyone involved.
meanings.sent4: The foreclosure was like a giant sale, with the property as the main item up for grabs.
meanings.sent5: The foreclosure auction was a last resort to settle the outstanding debt on the property.
